reviews.review_msg: This was the most difficult language course I've ever taken, and that's including Latin. She is very knowledgeable in Japanese, but her teaching skills and organization are weak. Class time barely focused on grammar. There were many in-class assignments that just didn't help if you couldn't understand the readings... Also, her book had many typos.

The way she taught was awesome, inspiring. You could actually improve your Japanese listening skills since she spoke basic Japanese phrases quite often. However, her textbooks were too much and not useful for learning grammar. So you would end up learning nothing from her course.

Omae sensei is tough, but not as bad as people say. She's a pretty fair marker, and REALLY NICE! Her teaching method has some pros and cons like all other profs. If you take her class, your speaking skills will improve. However, you really have to study to get the grammar parts, because she doesn't really teach you those that thoroughly.

This prof will give u good grade if you know some serious kiss ass skills. which may be the only skill u will need to succeed her class. Overall, i thought her grading system is extremely unfair and shows obvious favoritism towards certain people. It really hurts students with honest efforts.
she is a ****! worst prof ever!

I don't know how they approved her as a prof. She was the worse prof I've ever had. She has no teaching skills & marks unnecessarily hard to make the class seem important. Irrelevant topics in class, learned nothing. Her teaching 'skills' make me refuse to take any upper level jap courses. My experience with her was waste of money & time.
